com.yantra.api.omp.payment

Interface executePaymentTransactions

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface executePaymentTransactions

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document executePaymentTransactions(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The executePaymentTransactions API authorizes or charges a list of payments without an existing order.

    • Method Detail

      • executePaymentTransactions

        org.w3c.dom.Document executePaymentTransactions(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The executePaymentTransactions API authorizes or charges a list of payments without an existing order. Order information may be passed, but the results will not be persisted in the database against the order.
        This API supports all payment types. The payment list will be processed in the exact same order as they appeared in the input XML. Results will not be persisted to the database; the user is responsible for persisting any transactions executed by this API.

        The API will validate the XML and verify that the payment User Exits are implemented. When error occurs either through exceptions or through hold flag, the API terminates immediately returning all processed transactions and note that the remaining transactions will not be executed. The PaymentTransactionFailed flag will be set to Y on the failed transaction.

        Should any system failure occurs YFSUserExitException and Exception are handled by this API, however, it is recommended that YFSUserExitException should be used. In addition, the user exit can cause the payment transaction to fail by setting HoldOrderAndRaiseEvent to Y. In either case, the API stop processing further payment and yield all the processed output.

        In the event of failure, the API attempts to retrieve the errorCode and errorMessage from the exception thrown in the user exit. A generic error message will be provided if not available.

        executePaymentTransactions ignores the recordAdditionalTransactions field on the output struct. Instead, this API should be called multiple times to process any reversals and reauthorizations separately.

        It is recommended that tokenization of primary account numbers be used, and that tokens be passed to this API instead of raw primary account numbers. Sterling Commerce provides an application called the Sterling Sensitive Data Capture Server to capture and tokenize credit card or store value card primary account numbers. It is recommended that you review the Sterling Selling and Fulfillment Suite: Secure Deployment Guide for Sterling's approach to meeting PCI PA-DSS requirements. Encryption is not supported in this API. The user exit implementation is responsible for identifying whether the input is encrypted or tokenized. If the input to the user exit is encrypted, the output should also be encrypted and vice versa.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: The executePaymentTransactions API invokes one or more of the following user exits to process payments.

          com.yantra. yfs.japi.ue.YFSCollectionCreditCardUE
          com. yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSCollectionCustomerAccountUE
          com.yantra.yfs. japi.ue.YFSCollectionOthersUE
          com. yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSCollectionStoredValueCardUE
          com.yantra. yfs.japi.ue.YFSCollectionDebitCardUE


        If the UserExit corresponding to the PaymentType of each payment transaction is not found, the following error is thrown.
        YFS10497 - UserExit not found.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Additional Information:

        Parameters:
        env - Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is a mandatory parameter.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the result of the transactions. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Yantra exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
